member.name: T:BaseX.Alignment
member.summary: Controls alignment for various UI elements. Vertical is first followed by Horizontal

member.name: T:BaseX.CurveAnimationTrack`1
member.summary: This supports full blown keyframes, each with different type - hold, linear interpolation or even curves with tangents for each frame This should support majority of animation needs, but also is the most expensive to evaluate

member.name: T:BaseX.DiscreteAnimationTrack`1
member.summary: This type of animation track can have key frames with different duration, but no interpolation between them All of the frames are effectively "Hold" type of animation. This can be very useful when the values are more sparse but don't require being interpolated between.

member.name: T:BaseX.RawAnimationTrack`1
member.summary: This type of animation track doesn't store any duration information - every element takes same amount of time This can be very efficient for homogenous animations, where the frames are all baked - no curves and no durations

member.name: T:BaseX.RawList`1
member.summary: No-frills list that wraps an accessible array.
member.typeparam: Type of elements contained by the list.

member.name: F:BaseX.RawList`1.Elements
P:BaseX.RawList`1.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of elements contained in the . Can also be set; setting the count is a direct change to the count integer and does not change the state of the array.
member.returns: The number of elements contained in the .

member.name: F:BaseX.ColorProfile.Linear
member.summary: Typically used for attributes like smoothness, and alpha clip.

member.name: F:BaseX.ColorProfile.sRGB
member.summary: Most assets are authored in sRGB. Used for albedo, specular color, emission, etc.

member.name: F:BaseX.ColorProfile.sRGBAlpha
member.summary: Only used for legacy alpha blending.

member.name: F:BaseX.ColorProfileAwareOperation.UseLHS
member.summary: Prefer the left hand operand's color profile.

member.name: F:BaseX.ColorProfileAwareOperation.UseRHS
member.summary: Prefer the right hand operand's color profile.

member.name: F:BaseX.ColorProfileAwareOperation.UseLinear
member.summary: Apply the operation in linear space.

member.name: F:BaseX.ColorProfileAwareOperation.LinearIfUnequal
member.summary: Apply the operation in linear space only if the operands are not in the same profile.

member.name: F:BaseX.ColorAwareResult.leftHand
member.summary: Left hand side of the operation.

member.name: F:BaseX.ColorAwareResult.rightHand
member.summary: Right hand side of the operation.

member.name: F:BaseX.ColorAwareResult.profile
member.summary: Color profile derived from the operation.

member.name: M:BaseX.ColorProfileHelper.ConvertProfile(BaseX.color@,BaseX.ColorProfile,BaseX.ColorProfile)
member.summary: Converts an input color from a given profile, to a different profile.
member.returns: A converted color.

member.summary: Converts an input color in a given profile to linear
member.returns: A converted color.

member.name: M:BaseX.ColorProfileHelper.ToProfile(BaseX.color@,BaseX.ColorProfile)
member.summary: Converts an input linear color to a particular profile
member.returns: A converted color.

member.name: M:BaseX.ColorProfileHelper.LinearToProfile(System.Single,BaseX.ColorProfile)
member.summary: Converts an already linear value to a profile.
member.returns: The profile-correct value.

member.name: M:BaseX.ColorProfileHelper.ProfileToLinear(System.Single,BaseX.ColorProfile)
member.summary: Converts a value in a non-linear profile to linear.
member.returns: A linear value.

member.name: M:BaseX.ColorProfileHelper.GetOperands(BaseX.colorX@,BaseX.colorX@,BaseX.ColorProfileAwareOperation)
member.summary: Used for color profile aware operations, such as lerp.
member.param: The profile option, e.g., left hand profile, right hand profile, linear, etc.
member.returns: The colors in the targeted color profile.

member.name: T:BaseX.colorX
member.summary: A managed color that can automatically convert between an original base color and a linear color.

member.name: P:BaseX.colorX.LinearColor
member.summary: Retrieves the cached linear color.

member.name: P:BaseX.colorX.Luminance
member.summary: Computes luminance information based upon an input color, evaluating red, green, and blue channels.
member.param: The input color to compute luminance data from.
member.returns: The calculated luminance.

member.name: M:BaseX.MathX.NthOrderStatistic``1(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0},System.Int32,System.Random)
member.summary: Returns Nth smallest element from the list. Here n starts from 0 so that n=0 returns minimum, n=1 returns 2nd smallest element etc. Note: specified list would be mutated in the process. Reference: Introduction to Algorithms 3rd Edition, Corman et al, pp 216

member.name: M:BaseX.MathX.ReoderAndComputeMedian``1(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0})
member.summary: Note: specified list would be mutated in the process.

member.name: P:BaseX.color.Luminance
member.summary: Computes luminance information based upon an input color, evaluating red, green, and blue channels.
member.param: The input color to compute luminance data from.
member.returns: The calculated luminance.

member.name: M:BaseX.ConvexHullHelper.GetConvexHull(BaseX.RawList{BaseX.float3},BaseX.RawList{System.Int32})
member.summary: Identifies the indices of points in a set which are on the outer convex hull of the set.
member.param: List of points in the set.
List of indices into the input point set composing the triangulated surface of the convex hull. Each group of 3 indices represents a triangle on the surface of the hull.

member.name: M:BaseX.PointMerger.RemoveRedundantPoints(BaseX.RawList{BaseX.float3},System.Double)
member.summary: Removes redundant points. Two points are redundant if they occupy the same hash grid cell.
member.param: Size of cells to determine redundancy.

member.name: T:BaseX.ExceptionWrapperStream
member.summary: This stream catches any exceptions coming from the inner stream, so they do not propagate outside. This is necessary for when Streams are used for an interop with native code, because exceptions cannot be propagated through native stack on certain platforms (e.g. Linux), which results them being treated as unhandled exceptions. See here: https://www.mono-project.com/docs/advanced/pinvoke/#runtime-exception-propagation

member.name: M:BaseX.StringHelper.CountOcurrences(System.String,System.String,System.StringComparison)
member.summary: Count the occurences of pattern within the string text.
member.returns: Count of occurences of pattern within text.

member.name: T:System.half
member.summary: Represents a half-precision floating point number.
member.remarks:
Note: Half is not fast enought and precision is also very bad, so is should not be used for matemathical computation (use Single instead). The main advantage of Half type is lower memory cost: two bytes per number. Half is typically used in graphical applications.
Note: All functions, where is used conversion half->float/float->half, are approx. ten times slower than float->double/double->float, i.e. ~3ns on 2GHz CPU.
References: - Fast Half Float Conversions, Jeroen van der Zijp, link: http://www.fox-toolkit.org/ftp/fasthalffloatconversion.pdf - IEEE 754 revision, link: http://grouper.ieee.org/groups/754/

member.name: F:System.half.value
member.summary: Internal representation of the half-precision floating-point number.

member.name: F:System.half.Epsilon
member.summary: Represents the smallest positive System.Half value greater than zero. This field is constant.

member.name: F:System.half.MaxValue
member.summary: Represents the largest possible value of System.Half. This field is constant.

member.name: F:System.half.MinValue
member.summary: Represents the smallest possible value of System.Half. This field is constant.

member.name: F:System.half.NaN
member.summary: Represents not a number (NaN). This field is constant.

member.name: F:System.half.NegativeInfinity
member.summary: Represents negative infinity. This field is constant.

member.name: F:System.half.PositiveInfinity
member.summary: Represents positive infinity. This field is constant.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of System.Half to the value of the specified single-precision floating-point number.
member.param: The value to represent as a System.Half.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of System.Half to the value of the specified 32-bit signed integer.

member.param: The value to represent as a System.Half.

member.param: The value to represent as a System.Half.

member.param: The value to represent as a System.Half.

member.param: The value to represent as a System.Half.

member.param: The value to represent as a System.Half.

member.name: M:System.half.Negate(System.half)
member.summary: Returns the result of multiplying the specified System.Half value by negative one.
member.returns: A System.Half with the value of half, but the opposite sign. -or- Zero, if half is zero.

member.name: M:System.half.Add(System.half,System.half)
member.summary: Adds two specified System.Half values.
member.returns: A System.Half value that is the sum of half1 and half2.

member.name: M:System.half.Subtract(System.half,System.half)
member.summary: Subtracts one specified System.Half value from another.
member.returns: The System.Half result of subtracting half2 from half1.

member.name: M:System.half.Multiply(System.half,System.half)
member.summary: Multiplies two specified System.Half values.
member.returns: A System.Half that is the result of multiplying half1 and half2.

member.name: M:System.half.Divide(System.half,System.half)
member.summary: Divides two specified System.Half values.
member.returns: The System.Half that is the result of dividing half1 by half2.

member.name: M:System.half.op_UnaryPlus(System.half)
member.summary: Returns the value of the System.Half operand (the sign of the operand is unchanged).
member.returns: The value of the operand, half.

member.name: M:System.half.op_UnaryNegation(System.half)
member.summary: Negates the value of the specified System.Half operand.
member.returns: The result of half multiplied by negative one (-1).

member.name: M:System.half.op_Increment(System.half)
member.summary: Increments the System.Half operand by 1.
member.returns: The value of half incremented by 1.

member.name: M:System.half.op_Decrement(System.half)
member.summary: Decrements the System.Half operand by one.
member.returns: The value of half decremented by 1.

member.name: M:System.half.op_Addition(System.half,System.half)
member.summary: Adds two specified System.Half values.
member.returns: The System.Half result of adding half1 and half2.

member.name: M:System.half.op_Subtraction(System.half,System.half)
member.summary: Subtracts two specified System.Half values.
member.returns: The System.Half result of subtracting half1 and half2.

member.name: M:System.half.op_Multiply(System.half,System.half)
member.summary: Multiplies two specified System.Half values.
member.returns: The System.Half result of multiplying half1 by half2.

member.name: M:System.half.op_Division(System.half,System.half)
member.summary: Divides two specified System.Half values.
member.returns: The System.Half result of half1 by half2.

member.name: M:System.half.op_Equality(System.half,System.half)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether two instances of System.Half are equal.
member.returns: true if half1 and half2 are equal; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.half.op_Inequality(System.half,System.half)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether two instances of System.Half are not equal.
member.returns: true if half1 and half2 are not equal; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.half.op_LessThan(System.half,System.half)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether a specified System.Half is less than another specified System.Half.
member.returns: true if half1 is less than half1; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.half.op_GreaterThan(System.half,System.half)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether a specified System.Half is greater than another specified System.Half.
member.returns: true if half1 is greater than half2; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.half.op_LessThanOrEqual(System.half,System.half)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether a specified System.Half is less than or equal to another specified System.Half.
member.returns: true if half1 is less than or equal to half2; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.half.op_GreaterThanOrEqual(System.half,System.half)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether a specified System.Half is greater than or equal to another specified System.Half.
member.returns: true if half1 is greater than or equal to half2; otherwise, false.

member.returns: A signed number indicating the relative values of this instance and value. Return Value Meaning Less than zero This instance is less than value. Zero This instance is equal to value. Greater than zero This instance is greater than value.

member.name: M:System.half.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares this instance to a specified System.Object.
member.returns: A signed number indicating the relative values of this instance and value. Return Value Meaning Less than zero This instance is less than value. Zero This instance is equal to value. Greater than zero This instance is greater than value. -or- value is null.

member.name: M:System.half.Equals(System.half)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether this instance and a specified System.Half object represent the same value.
member.param: A System.Half object to compare to this instance.
member.returns: true if value is equal to this instance; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.half.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether this instance and a specified System.Object represent the same type and value.
member.returns: true if value is a System.Half and equal to this instance; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.half.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer hash code.

member.name: M:System.half.GetBytes(System.half)

member.returns: An array of bytes with length 2.

member.name: M:System.half.GetBits(System.half)
member.summary: Converts the value of a specified instance of System.Half to its equivalent binary representation.

member.name: M:System.half.ToHalf(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a half-precision floating point number converted from two bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: A half-precision floating point number formed by two bytes beginning at startIndex.
member.exception: startIndex is greater than or equal to the length of value minus 1, and is less than or equal to the length of value minus 1.
startIndex is less than zero or greater than the length of value minus 1.

member.name: M:System.half.ToHalf(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Returns a half-precision floating point number converted from its binary representation.
member.returns: A half-precision floating point number formed by its binary representation.

member.name: M:System.half.Sign(System.half)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating the sign of a half-precision floating-point number.
member.returns: A number indicating the sign of value. Number Description -1 value is less than zero. 0 value is equal to zero. 1 value is greater than zero.

member.name: M:System.half.Abs(System.half)

member.param: A number in the range System.Half.MinValue value System.Half.MaxValue.
member.returns: A half-precision floating-point number, x, such that 0 x System.Half.MaxValue.

member.name: M:System.half.Max(System.half,System.half)
member.summary: Returns the larger of two half-precision floating-point numbers.

The second of two half-precision floating-point numbers to compare.
member.returns: Parameter value1 or value2, whichever is larger. If value1, or value2, or both val1 and value2 are equal to System.Half.NaN, System.Half.NaN is returned.

member.name: M:System.half.Min(System.half,System.half)
member.summary: Returns the smaller of two half-precision floating-point numbers.

The second of two half-precision floating-point numbers to compare.

member.name: M:System.half.TryParse(System.String,System.half@)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a number to its System.Half equivalent. A return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed.
member.param: The string representation of the number to convert.

When this method returns, contains the System.Half number that is equivalent to the numeric value contained in value, if the conversion succeeded, or is zero if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the s parameter is null, is not a number in a valid format, or represents a number less than System.Half.MinValue or greater than System.Half.MaxValue. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if s was converted successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.half.TryParse(System.String,System.Globalization.NumberStyles,System.IFormatProvider,System.half@)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a number to its System.Half equivalent using the specified style and culture-specific format. A return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed.
member.param: The string representation of the number to convert.
A bitwise combination of System.Globalization.NumberStyles values that indicates the permitted format of value. A typical value to specify is System.Globalization.NumberStyles.Number.
An System.IFormatProvider object that supplies culture-specific parsing information about value.

When this method returns, contains the System.Half number that is equivalent to the numeric value contained in value, if the conversion succeeded, or is zero if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the s parameter is null, is not in a format compliant with style, or represents a number less than System.Half.MinValue or greater than System.Half.MaxValue. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if s was converted successfully; otherwise, false.
member.exception: style is not a System.Globalization.NumberStyles value. -or- style is the System.Globalization.NumberStyles.AllowHexSpecifier value.

member.name: T:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream
member.summary: MemoryStream implementation that deals with pooling and managing memory streams which use potentially large buffers.
member.remarks:
This class works in tandem with the RecylableMemoryStreamManager to supply MemoryStream objects to callers, while avoiding these specific problems: 1. LOH allocations - since all large buffers are pooled, they will never incur a Gen2 GC 2. Memory waste - A standard memory stream doubles its size when it runs out of room. This leads to continual memory growth as each stream approaches the maximum allowed size. 3. Memory copying - Each time a MemoryStream grows, all the bytes are copied into new buffers. This implementation only copies the bytes when GetBuffer is called. 4. Memory fragmentation - By using homogeneous buffer sizes, it ensures that blocks of memory can be easily reused.
The stream is implemented on top of a series of uniformly-sized blocks. As the stream's length grows, additional blocks are retrieved from the memory manager. It is these blocks that are pooled, not the stream object itself.
The biggest wrinkle in this implementation is when GetBuffer() is called. This requires a single contiguous buffer. If only a single block is in use, then that block is returned. If multiple blocks are in use, we retrieve a larger buffer from the memory manager. These large buffers are also pooled, split by size--they are multiples of a chunk size (1 MB by default).
Once a large buffer is assigned to the stream the blocks are NEVER again used for this stream. All operations take place on the large buffer. The large buffer can be replaced by a larger buffer from the pool as needed. All blocks and large buffers are maintained in the stream until the stream is disposed (unless AggressiveBufferReturn is enabled in the stream manager).

member.name: F:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.blocks
member.summary: All of these blocks must be the same size

member.name: F:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.byteBuffer
member.summary: This buffer exists so that WriteByte can forward all of its calls to Write without creating a new byte[] buffer on every call.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.dirtyBuffers
member.summary: This list is used to store buffers once they're replaced by something larger. This is for the cases where you have users of this class that may hold onto the buffers longer than they should and you want to prevent race conditions which could corrupt the data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.largeBuffer
member.summary: This is only set by GetBuffer() if the necessary buffer is larger than a single block size, or on construction if the caller immediately requests a single large buffer.
member.remarks: If this field is non-null, it contains the concatenation of the bytes found in the individual blocks. Once it is created, this (or a larger) largeBuffer will be used for the life of the stream.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.Tag
member.summary: A temporary identifier for the current usage of this stream.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.MemoryManager
member.summary: Gets the memory manager being used by this stream.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.AllocationStack
member.summary: Callstack of the constructor. It is only set if MemoryManager.GenerateCallStacks is true, which should only be in debugging situations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.DisposeStack
member.summary: Callstack of the Dispose call. It is only set if MemoryManager.GenerateCallStacks is true, which should only be in debugging situations.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.#ctor(Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager)
member.summary: Allocate a new RecyclableMemoryStream object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.#ctor(Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager,System.String)
member.summary: Allocate a new RecyclableMemoryStream object
member.param: A string identifying this stream for logging and debugging purposes

member.name: M:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.#ctor(Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allocate a new RecyclableMemoryStream object
member.param: A string identifying this stream for logging and debugging purposes
The initial requested size to prevent future allocations

member.name: M:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.#ctor(Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager,System.String,System.Int32,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Allocate a new RecyclableMemoryStream object
member.param: A string identifying this stream for logging and debugging purposes
The initial requested size to prevent future allocations
An initial buffer to use. This buffer will be owned by the stream and returned to the memory manager upon Dispose.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the memory used by this stream back to the pool.
member.param: Whether we're disposing (true), or being called by the finalizer (false)

member.name: M:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.Close
member.summary: Equivalent to Dispose

member.name: P:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.Capacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the capacity
member.remarks: Capacity is always in multiples of the memory manager's block size, unless the large buffer is in use. Capacity never decreases during a stream's lifetime. Explicitly setting the capacity to a lower value than the current value will have no effect. This is because the buffers are all pooled by chunks and there's little reason to allow stream truncation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.Length
member.summary: Gets the number of bytes written to this stream.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.Position
member.summary: Gets the current position in the stream

member.name: P:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.CanRead
member.summary: Whether the stream can currently read

member.name: P:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.CanSeek
member.summary: Whether the stream can currently seek

member.name: P:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.CanTimeout
member.summary: Always false

member.name: P:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.CanWrite
member.summary: Whether the stream can currently write

member.name: M:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.GetBuffer
member.summary: Returns a single buffer containing the contents of the stream. The buffer may be longer than the stream length.
member.returns: A byte[] buffer
member.remarks: IMPORTANT: Doing a Write() after calling GetBuffer() invalidates the buffer. The old buffer is held onto until Dispose is called, but the next time GetBuffer() is called, a new buffer from the pool will be required.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.ToArray
member.summary: Returns a new array with a copy of the buffer's contents. You should almost certainly be using GetBuffer combined with the Length to access the bytes in this stream. Calling ToArray will destroy the benefits of pooled buffers, but it is included for the sake of completeness.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads from the current position into the provided buffer
member.param: Offset into buffer at which to start placing the read bytes.
member.returns: The number of bytes read
member.exception: offset or count is less than 0
offset subtracted from the buffer length is less than count

member.name: M:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.SafeRead(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Reads from the specified position into the provided buffer
member.param: Offset into buffer at which to start placing the read bytes.
Position in the stream to start reading from
member.returns: The number of bytes read
member.exception: offset or count is less than 0
offset subtracted from the buffer length is less than count

member.name: M:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes the buffer to the stream
member.exception: buffer.Length - offset is not less than count

member.name: M:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.ToString
member.summary: Returns a useful string for debugging. This should not normally be called in actual production code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.WriteByte(System.Byte)
member.summary: Writes a single byte to the current position in the stream.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.ReadByte
member.summary: Reads a single byte from the current position in the stream.
member.returns: The byte at the current position, or -1 if the position is at the end of the stream.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.SafeReadByte(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Reads a single byte from the specified position in the stream.
member.param: The position in the stream to read from
member.returns: The byte at the current position, or -1 if the position is at the end of the stream.

member.summary: Sets the position to the offset from the seek location
member.returns: The new position

member.name: M:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.WriteTo(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Synchronously writes this stream's bytes to the parameter stream.
member.remarks: Important: This does a synchronous write, which may not be desired in some situations

member.name: M:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream.ReleaseLargeBuffer
member.summary: Release the large buffer (either stores it for eventual release or returns it immediately).

member.name: T:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager
member.summary: Manages pools of RecyclableMemoryStream objects.
member.remarks:
There are two pools managed in here. The small pool contains same-sized buffers that are handed to streams as they write more data.
For scenarios that need to call GetBuffer(), the large pool contains buffers of various sizes, all multiples of LargeBufferMultiple (1 MB by default). They are split by size to avoid overly-wasteful buffer usage. There should be far fewer 8 MB buffers than 1 MB buffers, for example.

member.name: T:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.EventHandler
member.summary: Generic delegate for handling events without any arguments.

member.name: T:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.StreamLengthReportHandler
member.summary: Delegate for handling reports of stream size when streams are allocated

member.name: T:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.UsageReportEventHandler
member.summary: Delegate for handling periodic reporting of memory use statistics.
member.param: Bytes currently in use in the small pool.
Bytes currently free in the small pool.
Bytes currently in use in the large pool.
Bytes currently free in the large pool.

member.name: F:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.largePools
member.summary: pools[0] = 1x largeBufferMultiple buffers pools[1] = 2x largeBufferMultiple buffers etc., up to maximumBufferSize

member.name: M:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes the memory manager with the default block/buffer specifications.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes the memory manager with the given block requiredSize.
member.param: Size of each block that is pooled. Must be > 0.
Each large buffer will be a multiple of this value.
Buffers larger than this are not pooled
member.exception: blockSize is not a positive number, or largeBufferMultiple is not a positive number, or maximumBufferSize is less than blockSize.
maximumBufferSize is not a multiple of largeBufferMultiple

member.name: P:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.BlockSize
member.summary: The size of each block. It must be set at creation and cannot be changed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.LargeBufferMultiple
member.summary: All buffers are multiples of this number. It must be set at creation and cannot be changed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.MaximumBufferSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum buffer size.
member.remarks: Any buffer that is returned to the pool that is larger than this will be discarded and garbage collected.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.SmallPoolFreeSize
member.summary: Number of bytes in small pool not currently in use

member.name: P:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.SmallPoolInUseSize
member.summary: Number of bytes currently in use by stream from the small pool

member.name: P:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.LargePoolFreeSize
member.summary: Number of bytes in large pool not currently in use

member.name: P:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.LargePoolInUseSize
member.summary: Number of bytes currently in use by streams from the large pool

member.name: P:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.SmallBlocksFree
member.summary: How many blocks are in the small pool

member.name: P:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.LargeBuffersFree
member.summary: How many buffers are in the large pool

member.name: P:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.MaximumFreeSmallPoolBytes
member.summary: How many bytes of small free blocks to allow before we start dropping those returned to us.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.MaximumFreeLargePoolBytes
member.summary: How many bytes of large free buffers to allow before we start dropping those returned to us.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.MaximumStreamCapacity
member.summary: Maximum stream capacity in bytes. Attempts to set a larger capacity will result in an exception.
member.remarks: A value of 0 indicates no limit.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.GenerateCallStacks
member.summary: Whether to save callstacks for stream allocations. This can help in debugging. It should NEVER be turned on generally in production.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.AggressiveBufferReturn
member.summary: Whether dirty buffers can be immediately returned to the buffer pool. E.g. when GetBuffer() is called on a stream and creates a single large buffer, if this setting is enabled, the other blocks will be returned to the buffer pool immediately. Note when enabling this setting that the user is responsible for ensuring that any buffer previously retrieved from a stream which is subsequently modified is not used after modification (as it may no longer be valid).

member.name: M:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.GetBlock
member.summary: Removes and returns a single block from the pool.
member.returns: A byte[] array

member.name: M:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.GetLargeBuffer(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a buffer of arbitrary size from the large buffer pool. This buffer will be at least the requiredSize and always be a multiple of largeBufferMultiple.
member.param: The minimum length of the buffer
The tag of the stream returning this buffer, for logging if necessary.
member.returns: A buffer of at least the required size.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.ReturnLargeBuffer(System.Byte[],System.String)
member.summary: Returns the buffer to the large pool
member.param: The tag of the stream returning this buffer, for logging if necessary.
member.exception: buffer.Length is not a multiple of LargeBufferMultiple (it did not originate from this pool)

member.name: M:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.ReturnBlocks(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Byte[]},System.String)
member.summary: Returns the blocks to the pool
member.param: Collection of blocks to return to the pool
The tag of the stream returning these blocks, for logging if necessary.
member.exception: blocks contains buffers that are the wrong size (or null) for this memory manager

member.name: M:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.GetStream
member.summary: Retrieve a new MemoryStream object with no tag and a default initial capacity.
member.returns: A MemoryStream.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.GetStream(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve a new MemoryStream object with the given tag and a default initial capacity.
member.param: A tag which can be used to track the source of the stream.
member.returns: A MemoryStream.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.GetStream(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieve a new MemoryStream object with the given tag and at least the given capacity.
member.param: A tag which can be used to track the source of the stream.
The minimum desired capacity for the stream.
member.returns: A MemoryStream.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.GetStream(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieve a new MemoryStream object with the given tag and at least the given capacity, possibly using a single continugous underlying buffer.
member.remarks: Retrieving a MemoryStream which provides a single contiguous buffer can be useful in situations where the initial size is known and it is desirable to avoid copying data between the smaller underlying buffers to a single large one. This is most helpful when you know that you will always call GetBuffer on the underlying stream.
member.param: A tag which can be used to track the source of the stream.
The minimum desired capacity for the stream.
Whether to attempt to use a single contiguous buffer.
member.returns: A MemoryStream.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.GetStream(System.String,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieve a new MemoryStream object with the given tag and with contents copied from the provided buffer. The provided buffer is not wrapped or used after construction.
member.remarks: The new stream's position is set to the beginning of the stream when returned.
member.param: A tag which can be used to track the source of the stream.
The byte buffer to copy data from.
The offset from the start of the buffer to copy from.
The number of bytes to copy from the buffer.
member.returns: A MemoryStream.
